question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Danone recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, either Coca-Cola or Danone announces a recall of any of their products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by the respective company (Coca-Cola or Danone) or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs for either company within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Colorado enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Colorado enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local Colorado news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in Colorado. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024, or Colorado enact a new law modifying restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights by August 31, 2024. The criteria for this are:
   1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
   2. The primary focus must be on abortion rights protection.
   3. The results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

(b) Colorado enacts a new law modifying or replacing current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth by July 31, 2024. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets. The law must specifically address and alter existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth.

If neither of these events occurs by their respective dates, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific reach a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address work schedule predictability, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania hold a referendum on renewable energy initiatives by August 2024?

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Tennessee enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body:

If either (a) or (b) occurs, the question will resolve as YES. If neither occurs, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. The community engagement requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Google face additional legal actions from the U.S. government by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google becomes subject to new legal actions initiated by any U.S. government entity. These legal actions may include, but are not limited to, lawsuits or regulatory actions. To qualify, the legal actions must be officially announced and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in New York City by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in New York City, New York. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a New York City rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will California hold a referendum on gun control measures by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on gun control measures. The referendum topic must directly address gun control, either proposing to introduce new regulations or to relax existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on gun control does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Arkansas Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Arkansas Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. question.body:

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will AstraZeneca allow generic production of its cancer treatment drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, AstraZeneca officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cancer treatment drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if AstraZeneca continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Astellas or AstraZeneca allow generic production of their respective cancer treatment drugs by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either of the following occurs: (a) Astellas officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its prostate cancer drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Astellas continues to enforce its patent rights, this part resolves as NO. (b) AstraZeneca officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cancer treatment drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if AstraZeneca continues to enforce its patent rights, this part resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Samsung announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Samsung publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Samsung only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

question.title: Will SAP announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, SAP publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if SAP only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

question.title: Will either Samsung or SAP announce plans to increase their AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either Samsung or SAP publicly announces plans to increase their AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if either company only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Israel announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Israel or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Israel members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will large protests occur in the United Kingdom in response to healthcare funding cuts by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either the Central Bank of Israel announce an interest rate cut or large protests occur in the UK due to healthcare funding cuts by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Israel officially announces a decrease in its interest rate, confirmed through official statements or reports by at least two major financial news sources, as a formal decision made by the Monetary Committee. (b) There are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets of large protests in the United Kingdom, involving at least 1,000 participants, specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. If neither of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The European Central Bank announces an interest rate cut, or (b) Hyundai Motor Company resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024:

(a) The European Central Bank (ECB) officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Speculation or unofficial statements do not count.

(b) Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. The strike must involve at least 1,000 Hyundai workers, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai and the union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If neither (a) nor (b) occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the S&P 500 index reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points. The 4,800 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,800 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points.

question.title: Will Shopify lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Shopify has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Shopify confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will either the S&P 500 index reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024, or will Shopify lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) At any point between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024, the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. Intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points. (b) By July 31, 2024, Shopify confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal. The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If neither of these events occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's climate disclosure rule be reinstated by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's rule on climate disclosures, previously blocked by a court decision, is reinstated. The reinstatement must be confirmed by official court documents or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The reinstatement could occur through a successful appeal, a reversal of the court's decision, or any other legal mechanism that results in the rule taking effect. If the rule remains blocked or is not reinstated by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the NASDAQ Composite index reach or exceed 15,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the NASDAQ Composite index reaches or exceeds 15,000 points. The 15,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the NASDAQ Stock Market. If the index does not reach 15,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 15,000 points.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) the U.S. SEC's climate disclosure rule be reinstated by July 2024, or (b) the NASDAQ Composite index reach or exceed 15,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's rule on climate disclosures, previously blocked by a court decision, is reinstated. The reinstatement must be confirmed by official court documents or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The reinstatement could occur through a successful appeal, a reversal of the court's decision, or any other legal mechanism that results in the rule taking effect. If the rule remains blocked or is not reinstated by the specified date, this part resolves as NO. (b) At any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the NASDAQ Composite index reaches or exceeds 15,000 points. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the NASDAQ Stock Market. If the index does not reach 15,000 points during this period, this part resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 15,000 points. If either (a) or (b) resolves as YES, the overall question resolves as YES.

question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Oregon hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oregon officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will either California or Oregon conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, either California or Oregon conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in their respective states. The criteria for each state are as follows:

For California:
1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

For Oregon:
1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Oregon state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If either state meets these criteria by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as YES. If neither state conducts such a referendum by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the International Monetary Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms or the IMF announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) There are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. (b) The International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If neither of these conditions is met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially approves MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) for use as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the approval must be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, not for any other condition or use. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly rejects or delays the approval beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) make an official public declaration stating that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either the FDA approve MDMA as a therapy for PTSD by August 2024 or Mexican authorities declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially approves MDMA (3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine) for use as a therapy for Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) by August 31, 2024. The approval must be confirmed through an official announcement from the FDA and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The approval must specifically be for the use of MDMA in treating PTSD, not for any other condition or use. If no such approval is granted by the resolution date, or if the FDA explicitly rejects or delays the approval beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. (b) Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) make an official public declaration by July 31, 2024, stating that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024 or Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:

If neither of these conditions is met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

question.title: Will Nevada maintain its $11 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, as of July 31, 2024, the minimum wage for fast food workers in Nevada remains at $11 per hour or higher. The wage must be confirmed through official Nevada state announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). If the wage is reduced below $11 per hour at any point by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'fast food workers' refers to employees in fast food restaurants as defined by Nevada state law.

question.title: Will either the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024, or will Nevada maintain its $11 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Tostitos in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 200,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will either PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 2024, or U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 31, 2024, compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Tostitos in North America, this part will resolve as NO. (b) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 200,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will the U.S. Education Department implement a plan to defer student loan payments by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Education Department has successfully implemented a plan to defer payments for student loan borrowers. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from the U.S. Education Department or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The plan must be a new initiative aimed at deferring payments for a significant number of student loan borrowers. If no such implementation occurs by the resolution date, or if the plan is blocked by further legal challenges, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will New Jersey hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, New Jersey officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the New Jersey state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major New Jersey-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in New Jersey and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) the U.S. Education Department implements a plan to defer student loan payments, or (b) New Jersey holds a referendum on abortion rights?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either (a) or (b) occurs by July 31, 2024. (a) The U.S. Education Department must implement a new plan to defer payments for a significant number of student loan borrowers, confirmed by official announcements or reports from at least two major news outlets. The plan must not be blocked by legal challenges. (b) New Jersey must officially conduct a statewide referendum on enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution, announced by the state government and verified by at least two major news organizations. The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in New Jersey and focus on abortion rights. If neither event occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will President Biden deliver a speech at a National Education Association event in Illinois by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden delivers a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in Illinois. The speech must be confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If no such speech occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United Food and Commercial Workers endorse a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) publicly endorses a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official UFCW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be considered for resolution.

(b) The United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) publicly endorses a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. question.title: Will a court rule on the liability of a major hotel chain operator by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court of law issues a ruling on whether a major hotel chain operator is liable for negligence or gross negligence in relation to an incident resulting in significant harm or loss. The ruling must be documented in official court records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or The New York Times). If no such ruling occurs by the resolution date, or if the case is settled out of court without a formal ruling, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the court to find the operator liable; it only requires a ruling to be made on the matter of liability.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

The ruling must be documented in official court records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or The New York Times). question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in San Diego by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in San Diego, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a San Diego rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the E. coli outbreak tied to beef result in more than 10 confirmed deaths by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to beef from a specific supplier. Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. If the death toll remains at 10 or fewer by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only deaths directly attributed to this specific outbreak will be counted.

question.title: Will Washington maintain its $16 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?

question.title: Will Google resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of Korea announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of Korea publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of Korea and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the base rate, which is the Bank of Korea's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for two consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for two consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will Alibaba Group resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Alibaba Group reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Indonesia specifically in response to new religious freedom legislation. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Indonesia. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of religious freedom legislation. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the legislation is rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?

The question resolves as NO if neither of these events occurs.

question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. The question resolves as NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will either Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year or the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, as verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). The increase must occur in the timeframe specified and be reported by the resolution date. (b) The Canadian economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada, at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. If either (a) or (b) is true, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the European Commission implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority or the European Commission implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. Appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution. (b) The European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If neither of these events occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an enforceable ethics code specifically for U.S. Congress members is officially adopted by the United States government. The adoption must be confirmed by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code must be legally binding and applicable to all sitting Congress members. It should outline clear standards of conduct and mechanisms for enforcement. If no such code meeting these criteria is established and officially adopted by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions about such a code do not qualify for a YES resolution; the code must be formally adopted and enforceable.

question.title: Will Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Michigan officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will either an enforceable ethics code for U.S. Congress members be established by July 2024, or will Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

This part of the question will resolve as NO if:
   - No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.

   - A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

The overall question will resolve as YES if either condition 1 or condition 2 is met.

question.title: Will Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Sara Lee officially announces a recall of any of its packaged meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce result in more than 10 confirmed deaths by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are official reports confirming more than 10 deaths attributed to the E. coli outbreak linked to lettuce from a specific producer. Official confirmation must come from credible sources such as the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or equivalent health authorities, and be reported by at least two reputable news outlets. The death toll must be specifically linked to this outbreak and not include deaths from unrelated E. coli cases. If the death toll remains at 10 or fewer by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only deaths directly attributed to this specific outbreak will be counted.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Sara Lee issue a recall of packaged meats due to a listeria outbreak, or (b) the E. coli outbreak tied to lettuce result in more than 10 confirmed deaths?
question.body:

   The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal.

question.title: Will a Texas woman's lawsuit against local authorities over an abortion-related arrest reach a settlement by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a publicly confirmed settlement is reached in the lawsuit filed by a Texas woman against local sheriff and prosecutors following her arrest and murder charge related to a self-managed abortion. The settlement must be officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). If no such settlement is confirmed by the specified date, or if the case is dismissed or proceeds to trial without a settlement, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Arizona enact legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Arizona officially passes and enacts legislation that imposes new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, such as bladed weapons or other non-firearm implements. The legislation must specifically address the carrying of these weapons in public spaces. For a YES resolution, the new law must be officially enacted and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Arizona news outlets). If no such legislation is passed and enacted by the specified date, or if any enacted legislation does not specifically restrict the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) a Texas woman's lawsuit against local authorities over an abortion-related arrest reach a settlement by July 2024, or (b) Arizona enact legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024?

The settlement must be officially announced by the involved parties or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). (b) By August 31, 2024, Arizona officially passes and enacts legislation that imposes new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, such as bladed weapons or other non-firearm implements. The legislation must specifically address the carrying of these weapons in public spaces. For a YES resolution, the new law must be officially enacted and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Arizona news outlets). If neither of these events occurs by their respective dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made machinery. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

   If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers that do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remains at or above 13.25% (b) Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike?

question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current measles outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing measles outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024, or the WHO declare the current measles outbreak over by August 2024?
