If neither of these events occurs by their respective resolution dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

question.title: Will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, South Korea's KOSPI index reaches or exceeds 3,500 points. The 3,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

question.title: Will either a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024, or will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

question.title: Will Andrew Bailey remain as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Andrew Bailey is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of England announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Bailey remaining in the position.

question.title: Will a government-developed AI system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a government-developed AI system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the government-developed AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Andrew Bailey remains as Governor of the Bank of England through July 2024, or (b) a government-developed AI system is reported for spreading election misinformation?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Andrew Bailey is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of England on July 31, 2024. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the government-developed AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this part will resolve as NO. The overall question resolves as YES if either part (a) or (b) resolves as YES.

question.title: Will a joint sports streaming venture by major media companies launch by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if a joint sports streaming venture involving at least two of the following companies: ESPN, Fox, or Warner Bros. Discovery, is officially launched by August 31, 2024. The launch must be confirmed by official announcements from the involved companies or reported by at least two major news outlets. If no such launch occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note: This question does not refer to any specific named venture, but rather to the concept of a joint sports streaming service by major media companies.

question.title: Will Paramount announce a new major sports media partnership by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Paramount publicly announces a new partnership related to major sports media rights or broadcasting. The partnership must be with a major sports league, organization, or event (such as NFL, MLB, NBA, FIFA World Cup, Olympics, etc.). The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Bloomberg, CNBC). Minor partnerships or those not primarily focused on sports media rights or broadcasting will not qualify. If no such announcement meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either a joint sports streaming venture by major media companies launch by August 2024, or will Paramount announce a new major sports media partnership by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) A joint sports streaming venture involving at least two of the following companies: ESPN, Fox, or Warner Bros. Discovery, is officially launched by August 31, 2024. The launch must be confirmed by official announcements from the involved companies or reported by at least two major news outlets. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Bloomberg, CNBC). If neither of these events occurs by their respective resolution dates, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Nigeria maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the government of Nigeria has not officially reversed its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions. The ban must remain in place without any changes that would effectively legalize the transactions. Confirmation of the ban's status should be available through official government sources or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. If the ban is reversed or significantly weakened to effectively allow cryptocurrency transactions before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either Nigeria maintain its ban on cryptocurrency transactions through August 2024, or will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following occurs by August 31, 2024:

(a) Nigeria maintains its ban on cryptocurrency transactions. This means that the government of Nigeria has not officially reversed its existing ban on cryptocurrency transactions, and the ban remains in place without any changes that would effectively legalize the transactions. Confirmation of the ban's status should be available through official government sources or reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. If the ban is reversed or significantly weakened to effectively allow cryptocurrency transactions before or during August 2024, this part resolves as NO.

(b) Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify, the bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, and it must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy. If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, this part resolves as NO.

The question resolves as NO only if neither (a) nor (b) occurs.

question.title: Will Apple fund full tuition for all Caltech physics students by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that Apple's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all physics students at Caltech, regardless of their family income. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If the funding does not cover full tuition for all physics students by the resolution date, or if it only covers tuition for a subset of students based on income or other criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Facebook resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Facebook reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Facebook workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

The question will resolve as NO if neither of the above conditions (a) or (b) are met by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:

3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Brazil's Bovespa index reach or exceed 130,000 points by August 2024?

If the index does not reach 130,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?

The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Michigan and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will either Kansas or Michigan hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, either Kansas or Michigan officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. For Michigan, the referendum must be focused on enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution and be formally announced by the Michigan state government. In both cases, the occurrence of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers or Michigan-based news outlets). If neither state holds or completes such a referendum by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

question.title: Will Apple Inc. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:

3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) Missouri officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be announced by the Missouri state government and verified by at least two major news organizations. It must be open to all eligible voters in Missouri and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if it is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. (b) The American Federation of Teachers (AFT) publicly endorses a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must be confirmed through official AFT statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. It must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Spain eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Spanish government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Spain eliminates export taxes on agricultural products, or (b) the United States reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans?

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current West Nile virus outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing West Nile virus outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Land O'Frost issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Land O'Frost officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Land O'Frost's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, this part will resolve as NO.

If the law remains in effect as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision.

Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. question.title: Will IBM lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If IBM confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Tiff Macklem is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024. question.title: Will a major hospital system in the Northeast US cancel over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?

This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

For the resolution to be considered valid, the strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union. Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

The combined question resolves as YES if either part (a) or part (b) resolves as YES.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The United States announces plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024, or (b) The U.S. Senate passes a bill to cut the Pentagon's budget by more than 20% by August 2024?

question.title: Will the Dream Chaser spacecraft complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Dream Chaser spacecraft successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Dream Chaser spacecraft transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The spacecraft must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by Sierra Nevada Corporation or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Dream Chaser spacecraft is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

question.title: Will a major Chinese battery company begin construction of a factory in Ohio by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Ohio, owned by a Chinese company, has officially commenced. Confirmation must come from at least two of the following sources: official company announcements, statements from the Ohio state government, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities like site clearing or permitting processes do not qualify as construction commencement. If no such construction has begun by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The U.S. government resume consideration of liquefied natural gas distribution projects by July 2024, or (b) A major Chinese battery company begin construction of a factory in Ohio?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) By July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at distributing liquefied natural gas (LNG). The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG distribution project applications by relevant federal agencies. If no such resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration remains in effect, the question resolves as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Ohio, owned by a Chinese company, has officially commenced. Confirmation must come from at least two of the following sources: official company announcements, statements from the Ohio state government, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities like site clearing or permitting processes do not qualify as construction commencement. If no such construction has begun by the specified date, or if the project is officially cancelled or indefinitely postponed, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Microsoft lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Microsoft has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Microsoft confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces a decrease in its target for the overnight interbank interest rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Mexico or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Board of Governors and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Mexico members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Microsoft lay off at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, or (b) The Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) Microsoft confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Microsoft confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, or if partial layoffs or phased implementations do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. (b) The Central Bank of Mexico officially announces a decrease in its target for the overnight interbank interest rate. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Mexico or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Board of Governors and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Mexico members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will large protests occur in Turkey in response to changes in media censorship laws by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Turkey specifically in response to changes in media censorship laws. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Turkey. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of media censorship law changes. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the law change is rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Azerbaijan become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Azerbaijan is formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance. For a positive resolution, the acceptance must be confirmed through official announcements from the BRICS alliance or any of its member countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The formal acceptance must include Azerbaijan as a full member, not just an observer or associate member. If no such acceptance occurs by the resolution date, or if Azerbaijan's membership is still pending or under consideration, the question resolves as NO.

The formal acceptance must include Azerbaijan as a full member, not just an observer or associate member. question.title: Will Missouri hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Missouri holds a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case regarding abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. Note that merely scheduling a referendum is not sufficient for a YES resolution; the actual vote must take place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Tennessee hold a referendum on labor laws by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Tennessee officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on reforming labor laws in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Tennessee Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of labor laws. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will either Missouri hold a referendum on abortion rights or Tennessee hold a referendum on labor laws by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) Missouri holds a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case regarding abortion rights. (b) Tennessee officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on reforming labor laws in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Tennessee Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of labor laws. This question will resolve as NO if neither of these referenda occurs by the specified date.

question.title: Will Wisconsin remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Wisconsin officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan. The change must be confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the work requirement remains in place, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will either Wisconsin remove the work requirement from its Medicaid plan by July 2024, or will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) By July 31, 2024, the state of Wisconsin officially announces the removal of the work requirement from its Medicaid plan, confirmed through official state announcements or reported by at least two major news organizations. The work requirement refers to the condition that beneficiaries must work or engage in other qualifying activities to receive Medicaid benefits. (b) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Florida enact legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially passes and enacts legislation that imposes new restrictions on the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, such as bladed weapons or other non-firearm implements. The legislation must specifically address the carrying of these weapons in public spaces. For a YES resolution, the new law must be officially enacted and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, local Florida news outlets). If no such legislation is passed and enacted by the specified date, or if any enacted legislation does not specifically restrict the public carrying of non-firearm weapons, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Arizona enact legislation restricting the public carrying of non-firearm weapons by August 2024?

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official ECB communications, such as press releases, Governing Council statements, or public speeches by ECB officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the main refinancing operations rate, which is the ECB's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Apple finalize a union contract with store employees in Arizona by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Arizona. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Florida's abortion law allowing procedures up to 15 weeks remain unchanged by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 15 weeks remains in effect without any changes. The status of the law must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Florida newspapers). If the law is modified, replaced, or overturned by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 15-week limit.

question.title: Will Wisconsin enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Wisconsin enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Mario Draghi remain as President of the Italian Republic through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mario Draghi is still serving as the President of the Italian Republic on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Italian Republic announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as President by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting President appointments will not be considered as Draghi remaining in the position.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Russia announce a ruble stabilization program by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Russia officially announces a ruble stabilization program. question.title: Will Hyundai initiate a recall of over 720,000 vehicles due to a seatbelt issue by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Hyundai has officially announced and begun the process of recalling more than 720,000 vehicles due to an issue with the seatbelt system. The recall must be specifically related to seatbelts that may not properly secure passengers, as mentioned in the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) report. Confirmation of the recall initiation must come from official Hyundai statements or reports by at least two reputable news sources. The question resolves as NO if Hyundai has not announced or begun such a recall by the specified date, or if the number of vehicles affected is 720,000 or fewer.

question.title: Will Hyundai's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Hyundai reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the EPA's Clean Power Plan be reinstated by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Environmental Protection Agency's Clean Power Plan, which was previously repealed, is reinstated through legal or administrative means. Reinstatement must be confirmed through official announcements by the EPA, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The reinstatement must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. If the plan is not reinstated and in effect by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial reinstatements or modifications to the original plan that still substantially achieve its goals would qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the United Nations announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?

question.title: Will the Brazilian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Brazilian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Brazilian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Hang Seng Index reach or exceed 30,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Hang Seng Index reaches or exceeds 30,000 points. The 30,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 30,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 30,000 points.

question.title: Will either the Brazilian economy avoid a recession by July 2024 or the Hang Seng Index reach or exceed 30,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Brazilian economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024. For this, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics, occurring between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Hang Seng Index reaches or exceeds 30,000 points at any time between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. For the Hang Seng Index, intraday highs count for resolution, and verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Hormel Foods issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:

1. An official announcement on Hormel Foods' website or social media channels
2. A press release from Hormel Foods
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hormel Foods recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) Arizona's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional, or (b) The United Auto Workers endorse a candidate who is a former secretary of state?
question.body:
(a) Arizona's near-total abortion ban will be declared constitutional if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms its constitutionality. If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, this part resolves as NO. (b) The United Auto Workers (UAW) will endorse a candidate who is a former secretary of state if, by July 31, 2024, the UAW officially endorses such a candidate for the presidential election. question.title: Will Eli Lilly allow generic production of its insulin product by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Eli Lilly officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its insulin product, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Eli Lilly continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of South Korea announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of South Korea officially announces a decrease in its Base Rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of South Korea or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of South Korea members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Maine maintain its 72-hour waiting period for gun purchases through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, Maine continues to enforce a 72-hour waiting period for gun purchases as part of its gun safety laws. The resolution will be based on official state regulations or announcements from Maine's government, confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Maine news outlets). If the waiting period is repealed, reduced, or extended beyond 72 hours by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. The waiting period must apply generally to gun purchases and not be limited to specific types of firearms or specific circumstances.
